intro: Barnadesia seleriana, commonly known as the Selerian barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are yellowish to orange in color, arranged in dense clusters, and are pollinated primarily by insects.
